settings.delivery_title: Made to order for you: ships by

settings.title: Handcrafted for you
settings.text: If this necklace is not in stock, it will be made to order for you within 3 to 4 weeks. If you need your purchase sooner, email hello@valeriemadison.com and we will advise if the item is in stock for immediate shipment or we will give you an estimate for your delivery date.

settings.title: Need styling help?
settings.text: Get in touch with our team and we can send you photos/video of the jewelry combos you're interested in.

settings.title: A note about pearl jewelry:
settings.text:
Pearls are delicate in nature.

As the saying goes, "pearls are the last thing you put on, and the first thing you take off".

We recommend avoiding water, chemical, soaps, perfumes, and lotions, as they can damage the fragility of a natural pearl's beauty and luster.

Pro tip: Use a soft, damp cloth to wipe down your pearls after wearing to keep them looking their best.

settings.title: What materials/ metals are used in your jewelry?
settings.text:
Valerie Madison prioritizes the use of recycled 14k gold whenever feasible.

Additionally, our commitment to ethical practices extends to our diamonds and gemstones, which are both conflict-free and sourced through fair trade. Our diamonds adhere to the Kimberley Process. Rather than engaging in bulk procurement and production, we meticulously choose honest and ethical stones from suppliers on an individual basis.

settings.title: What materials/ metals are used in your jewelry?
settings.text:
Valerie Madison® prioritizes the use of recycled 14k gold whenever feasible. Derived from repurposed sources such as existing jewelry, industrial metals, or electronic components, the gold undergoes a refining process to restore it to its purest form, ensuring its quality matches that of freshly mined metals.

Additionally, our commitment to ethical practices extends to our diamonds and gemstones, which are both conflict-free and sourced through fair trade. Our diamonds strictly adhere to The Kimberley Process. Rather than engaging in bulk procurement and production, we meticulously choose honest and ethical stones from suppliers on an individual basis.

settings.title: How do I take care of my jewelry?
settings.text: It is a good habit to remove all jewelry before sleeping, exercising, showering, gardening, heavy lifting, swimming, etc. Put your jewelry on after bathing, spraying perfumes, hairsprays, or lotions and cosmetics. Avoid chemical cleaners, abrasive polishing agents, and chlorine. A combination of mild soap, warm water, and a soft toothbrush may be used for cleaning. Refrain from using chemical jewelry cleaners outside of the products we've personally tested and recommend. A detailed jewelry care sheet can be found here.

settings.title: Do you offer a product warranty?
settings.text:
We do! Our warranty program covers polishing, setting repair, accent stone replacement, chain/clasp repairs, and re-welding. Detailed information on our warranty can be found here.

Please feel welcome to come by our shop for complimentary cleaning and inspection if you would like to have a pair of professional eyes on your piece.

settings.title: Made-to-Order vs. In Stock (ready to ship)
settings.text:
Some of our styles are made to order and require up to 4-6 weeks for creation. For quicker turnaround times, you are always welcome to get in touch with us to see if we might have your exact size/style in stock.

In-stock styles will be ready to ship immediately (unless resizing is required).

settings.title: BIPOC-Woman-Owned
settings.text: Valerie Madison is a Black Latina jewelry designer who brings unique perspectives and understanding to her clients.

settings.title: Seattle-based
settings.text: Valerie Madison is a Seattle native herself and draws inspiration from from our unique and beautiful PNW setting.

settings.title: Inspired by You
settings.text: We delight in helping you mark your love stories in gold. Whether it's bridal or an everyday treasure, we create jewelry to help you celebrate your unique self-expression.

settings.description: We work with production partners who align with our values on recycled gold, high grade gemstones, and ethically sourced diamonds.

settings.title: Reflect Diversity
settings.text: Valerie Madison is the PNW's only BIPOC-woman-owned fine jewelry store. Ready more about our company here.

settings.title: Visit our store!
settings.text: Located in the heart of Seattle's Madrona neighborhood, Valerie Madison is located in a light and airy space full of our best jewels. Learn more our shop's location here.
